1.long: Jesus; the Greek form of Joshua; Jesus, son of Eliezer; Jesus, surnamed Justus.
Timothy, a Christian of Lystra, helper of Paul.
a brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian.
Philemon, a Christian man of Colossae.

loved, beloved, with two special applications: the Beloved, a title of the Messiah (Christ), as beloved beyond all others by the God who sent Him; of Christians, as beloved by God, Christ, and one another.

2.long: Apphia, a Christian lady of Colossae, either wife or sister of Philemon.
a sister, a woman (fellow-)member of a church, a Christian woman.
a fellow soldier (in the Christian faith).

2.brief: down from, against, according to, throughout, during
2.long: gen: against, down from, throughout, by; acc: over against, among, daily, day-by-day, each day, according to, by way of.
(a) a house, the material building, (b) a household, family, lineage, nation.
an assembly, congregation, church; the Church, the whole body of Christian believers.

3.long: (a) grace, as a gift or blessing brought to man by Jesus Christ, (b) favor, (c) gratitude, thanks, (d) a favor, kindness.
peace, peace of mind; invocation of peace a common Jewish farewell, in the Hebraistic sense of the health (welfare) of an individual.
Jesus; the Greek form of Joshua; Jesus, son of Eliezer; Jesus, surnamed Justus.

4.long: I thank, give thanks; pass. 3 sing: is received with thanks.
(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause.

4.brief: on, to, against, on the basis of, at
4.long: on, to, against, on the basis of, at.
(a) prayer (to God), (b) a place for prayer (used by Jews, perhaps where there was no synagogue).

5.long: I hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported.
love, benevolence, good will, esteem; plur: love-feasts.
faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
Jesus; the Greek form of Joshua; Jesus, son of Eliezer; Jesus, surnamed Justus.
into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.

5.brief: all, the whole, every kind of
5.long: all, the whole, every kind of.
set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred.

6.brief: how, in order that, so that
6.long: how, in order that, so that, that.
(lit: partnership) (a) contributory help, participation, (b) sharing in, communion, (c) spiritual fellowship, a fellowship in the spirit.
faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
effective, productive of due result, at work.

6.brief: I come into being, am born
6.long: I come into being, am born, become, come about, happen.
knowledge of a particular point (directed towards a particular object); perception, discernment, recognition, intuition.

6.brief: all, the whole, every kind of
6.long: all, the whole, every kind of.
intrinsically good, good in nature, good whether it be seen to be so or not, the widest and most colorless of all words with this meaning.
into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.

7.long: joy, gladness, a source of joy.
a calling for, summons, hence: (a) exhortation, (b) entreaty, (c) encouragement, joy, gladness, (d) consolation, comfort.

7.brief: on, to, against, on the basis of, at
7.long: on, to, against, on the basis of, at.
love, benevolence, good will, esteem; plur: love-feasts.
that, since, because; may introduce direct discourse.
the inward parts; the heart, affections, seat of the feelings.
set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred.

7.brief: I make to rest, give rest to, rest, take my ease
7.long: I make to rest, give rest to; mid. and pass: I rest, take my ease.
(a) gen: through, throughout, by the instrumentality of, (b) acc: through, on account of, by reason of, for the sake of, because of.
a brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian.

8.long: freedom, openness, especially in speech; boldness, confidence.

9.long: (a) gen: through, throughout, by the instrumentality of, (b) acc: through, on account of, by reason of, for the sake of, because of.
love, benevolence, good will, esteem; plur: love-feasts.
(a) I send for, summon, invite, (b) I beseech, entreat, beg, (c) I exhort, admonish, (d) I comfort, encourage, console.

9.brief: as, like as, how, while, so that
9.long: as, like as, about, as it were, according as, how, when, while, as soon as, so that.
adv. (a) of time: just now, even now; just at hand, immediately, (b) of logical connection: now then, (c) in commands and appeals: at this instant.

9.brief: but, on the other hand, and
9.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
Jesus; the Greek form of Joshua; Jesus, son of Eliezer; Jesus, surnamed Justus.

10.long: (a) I send for, summon, invite, (b) I beseech, entreat, beg, (c) I exhort, admonish, (d) I comfort, encourage, console.

10.brief: I beget, bring forth, give birth to
10.long: I beget (of the male), (of the female) I bring forth, give birth to.
a bond, chain, imprisonment; a string or ligament, an impediment, infirmity.
(originally adj: useful, hence the play upon words in Philemon 10, 11, and very common as slave name), Onesimus, a slave of Philemon, a Christian of Colossae.

11.long: at one time or other, at some time, formerly.
adv. (a) of time: just now, even now; just at hand, immediately, (b) of logical connection: now then, (c) in commands and appeals: at this instant.

11.brief: but, on the other hand, and
11.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.

12.brief: I send up to a higher tribunal, I send back
12.long: I send up (to a higher tribunal), send back.

12.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
12.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
the inward parts; the heart, affections, seat of the feelings.

13.long: (a) I hold fast, bind, arrest, (b) I take possession of, lay hold of, (c) I hold back, detain, restrain, (d) I hold a ship, keep its head.
gen: in behalf of; acc: above.
I wait at table (particularly of a slave who waits on guests); I serve (generally).
a bond, chain, imprisonment; a string or ligament, an impediment, infirmity.
the good news of the coming of the Messiah, the gospel; the gen. after it expresses sometimes the giver (God), sometimes the subject (the Messiah, etc.), sometimes the human transmitter (an apostle).

14.brief: but, on the other hand, and
14.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
I will, wish, desire, am willing, intend, design.
(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause.

14.brief: as, like as, how, while, so that
14.long: as, like as, about, as it were, according as, how, when, while, as soon as, so that.

14.brief: down from, against, according to, throughout, during
14.long: gen: against, down from, throughout, by; acc: over against, among, daily, day-by-day, each day, according to, by way of.
necessity, constraint, compulsion; there is need to; force, violence.
intrinsically good, good in nature, good whether it be seen to be so or not, the widest and most colorless of all words with this meaning.

14.brief: down from, against, according to, throughout, during
14.long: gen: against, down from, throughout, by; acc: over against, among, daily, day-by-day, each day, according to, by way of.
willing, with right good will, voluntary, spontaneous.

15.long: (a) gen: through, throughout, by the instrumentality of, (b) acc: through, on account of, by reason of, for the sake of, because of.
(a) I separate, put apart, (b) mid. or pass: I separate myself, depart, withdraw.
(a) a definite space of time, a season, (b) an hour, (c) the particular time for anything.
age-long, and therefore: practically eternal, unending; partaking of the character of that which lasts for an age, as contrasted with that which is brief and fleeting.

15.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
15.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

15.brief: I have in full, am far, it is enough
15.long: I have in full, am far, it is enough.

16.long: as, like as, about, as it were, according as, how, when, while, as soon as, so that.
gen: in behalf of; acc: above.
a brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian.

loved, beloved, with two special applications: the Beloved, a title of the Messiah (Christ), as beloved beyond all others by the God who sent Him; of Christians, as beloved by God, Christ, and one another.

16.brief: how much, how great, how many
16.long: how much, how great, how many.

16.brief: but, on the other hand, and
16.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.

17.long: (a) I take to myself, (b) I take aside, (c) I welcome.

17.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

17.long: as, like as, about, as it were, according as, how, when, while, as soon as, so that.

18.brief: but, on the other hand, and
18.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
any one, some one, a certain one or thing.
I act unjustly towards, injure, harm.

18.brief: I charge to, put to one's account
18.long: I charge to, put to one's account, impute.

19.long: I write; pass: it is written, it stands written (in the scriptures).

19.brief: I repay, pay what is due
19.long: I repay, pay what is due (by way of punishment or fine), make good.
(denoting speech in progress), (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
that, since, because; may introduce direct discourse.

20.long: a brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian.

20.brief: I help, profit, have joy of
20.long: I profit, benefit, help; mid: I have profit, derive benefit.

20.brief: I make to rest, give rest to, rest, take my ease
20.long: I make to rest, give rest to; mid. and pass: I rest, take my ease.
the inward parts; the heart, affections, seat of the feelings.

that, since, because; may introduce direct discourse.
gen: in behalf of; acc: above.

22.long: at the same time, therewith, along with, together with.

22.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.

23.brief: I greet, salute, pay my respects to
23.long: I greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome.
Epaphras, Epaphroditus, a Colossian Christian, in captivity with Paul in Rome.
Jesus; the Greek form of Joshua; Jesus, son of Eliezer; Jesus, surnamed Justus.

24.long: Mark, who also had the Hebrew name John, son of Mary, nephew of Barnabas, coadjutor of Barnabas, Paul, and Peter.
Aristarchus, a Christian, belonging to Thessalonica in Macedonia.
Demas, a helper of Paul in Rome.
Lucas, Luke, Christian physician and writer of the Third Gospel and Acts.

25.long: (a) grace, as a gift or blessing brought to man by Jesus Christ, (b) favor, (c) gratitude, thanks, (d) a favor, kindness.
Jesus; the Greek form of Joshua; Jesus, son of Eliezer; Jesus, surnamed Justus.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
